description: Build a Cadbury Chocolate House Guide
name: Cadbury Christmas in July Recipe | Woolworths

recipeInstructions.text: Use a serrated knife to carefully cut off the bottom row of a block of chocolate. Repeat on a second block.
Keep one row to make the chimney later.
Cut diagonally from the centre of the top of a block outwards across 3 rows to make a triangular shaped roof. Repeat on the second block.
Take off cuts and break into a microwave-safe bowl.

Melt the chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl on 50% POWER. Begin with 20 second bursts then reduce to shorter bursts as the chocolate melts, stirring well periodically. Only heat until 75% of the chocolate has melted.
Spread melted chocolate along the short side of an uncut block and press together with the long side of the door (from step 1).
Repeat to form both sides of the house.
Shape house so corners are as square as possible. Allow a few minutes to stand.
To make the roof, spread a little chocolate around edges of the 2 remaining uncut blocks of chocolate and place onto the house, holding and pressing for a few moments to firm.

Make a diagonal cut in the reserved row of chocolate to make a chimney and stick to roof using melted chocolate. Use melted chocolate to attach Flake “roof”, marshmallow “smoke” and the mini Oreo “door handle”.
Decorate as desired and dust with icing sugar.
